title: RIOT if you're gonna buff Yasuo, can we remove his turret safety?
body:
I don't want him ulting me under tower from 1400 units away JUST to get placed outside of fucking turret range.

https://plays.tv/video/591367f3eaaddf6103/that-is-bullshi

P.S: There is a HUGE difference between ulting someone that’s RIGHT out of tower range, and ulting someone that’s sitting right on top on the tower

Hey. It's not a fucking massive safety net. It's just enough so that if he *can* be positioned 1) Next to you, and 2) Outside of turret range, he will be, rather than plopping him in it to eat a bunch of turret shots. It literally just rotates him around you, with *maybe* a 25 unit movement away from you.

It's not "Oh, he ulted you, but you're right next to turret, so we'll put him outside of it anyways", it's "Oh, you're literally ***just*** inside of turret range, so we'll rotate Yasuo around you so that he doesn't have to take turret shots for no reason".

He SHOULD be eating turret shots from the outset. No other champion has the ability to ignore the danger of engaging somebody under a tower. Not to mention, most of the time Yasuo does ult someone under tower, they are low enough to be worth diving. They should be able to outplay him, WITH the help of the turret that's supposed to be acting as a deterrent for these kinds of dives.

Well actually it kind of is. There is a difference between having an ability that grants you "untargetability" or "Invulnerability" and having a dash spell that purposely puts you away from danger for no reason at all.
So tryndamere running me down and doing illegal things to me under the tower with his ultimate active ISN'T ignoring the danger of the tower??

If you cant then ummm he deserves the kill, there are plenty of ways to kite and outmanuever him.

Unless you're a champ with some kind of mobility or CC in their kit, you're dead. And even then, QSS and Flash exist. Sure, there are plenty of ways to outmaneuver, but there are just as many ways for Tryndamere to close the gap. Half of his abilities are specifically for that, the other half are for mitigating damage. Why do people insist on pretending like champions don't do what they were built to do?
{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

To be honest, Tryndamere is a broken Champion that needs changes (the counterplay options to his Ultimate are severely lacking).
Don't think he's a sensible example to justify Yasuo's bullsh*ttery.

Not justifying Yasuo in any way. His champion has an inherent advantage over other champions. But he's not the only one who does, and we don't need to pretend like all other champions are fine just to get one fixed.

If a Vi Ults a champion under tower she doesn't get to saftley stay outside of tower range, she goes under tower and gets shot.

If WW ults somebo- you get the idea, no other champion which CC's themselves to deal damage has that safety net
Malz can do it from outside turret range and Vi and Warwick get pretty damn tanky so they survive several shots. Yasuo does not get tanky and none of his defensive skills work against turrets.
Yet he is the only champion in the game who has an ability which changes just because the enemy is under tower, how is that fair?

You're not quite making the right comparison.

Yas getting placed outside of tower range would be like Kled being automatically pushed out of tower range if he was dismounted under tower, not like Kled dropping tower aggro.

Regardless of the distance (and it's a bit more than you suggest,) there's zero excuse for this.  He ults someone who is inside turret range he should be eating turret shots.  Especially when for anyone else, that equals you getting ripped up by turrets.  Consistency would be nice.

Even I think Yasuo's "safety net" can be a little too much, and I main him.

I do want to mention one thing, if you get knocked up by Yasuo while he's outside turret range, and then he ults, which a pretty good Yasuo should do, he won't pick up turret aggro until after the ult animation anyway, since the damage is applied at the end, not the middle, but if yasuo is in turret range, then it's pretty dumb. (tbh, I almost never notice being put outside turret range, and actually putting me between them and the turret would make my escape much easier)
